posts.post_content:

If they don't, they lose in three turns. Pretty straightforward.

posts.post_content:
8 mana for total game domination... this thing can bypass most things without leaving a single drawback; besides, he is NICOL BOLAS!  
okok, you're right: 8 mana is a kick in the darn, but well, get this guy into the battlefield and ask gentlemanly to your opponent "do you concede or do I have to make you suffer?".  
Another good point is the non-Nicol Bolas elder dragon-cost (2UUBBRR); but its main problem is that it joins the battle too late, beside that this thing alone can handle your foe whole deck.

posts.post_content: If the game is at a point where a player can produce 8 mana out in 3 colors, none of which is green, and you can't muster some kind of answer to this in the next two turns, you deserve to take his ultimate in the face. He's damn powerful, but anything at that cost will be a force to be reckoned with and if you're not dropping your own bombs by then, you're probably going to lose anyway.

posts.post_content: I rated him five because he's Nicol Bolas. He bit Teferi in the head and showed him who's boss. Then beat up Leshrac and did the same. He's probably killed more planeswalkers then all other factors combined. Heck, his freaking first ability just outright kills them. And people thought Chandra was good at suppressing enemy walkers. Playwise, he's hard to get out and doesn't win the game as fast as Cruel Ultimatum or whatever, but don't forget, he's casting that spell in it's artwork. Points for Bolas.

posts.post_content:
He wins games singlehandedly if you cast him from a position of control (and really, in ![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol), are you ever not in a position of control?). I've seen so many games go   
T7: Opponent casts fattie. I let it resolve and opponent is all like "0\_0"  
T8: I cast Bolas, steal fattie to use as a blocker.  
T9 and on: Put the hurt on with Land D, artifact/enchantment removal, and a devastating ultimate that he can pull off in just a few turns.  
  
Amazing card; my favorite Planeswalker.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
I remember the first time I saw someone play this card. He played the plainswalker, stole my [Ertie, wizard adept](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ertie, wizard adept) and ended his turn. I took my turn, [Confiscate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Confiscate)ed Nico, and used him to steal my Ertie back. I ended the game shortly there after. (Me stealing the most expensive planswalker in the game sent me on a power trip of a week)  
  
Ironically, I later got the card from him, so I now own it. (Thought he didn't need it after he got [Jace, the Mind Sculptor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace, the Mind Sculptor), though I still had to trade half a deck for it).   
  
I will admit, he is harder to summon than I thought. Although, I did underestimate his ultimate; the first time I got him out I used it. This left my opponent with an empty hand, two lands left on the field, and Zero life. (Another week long power trip)  
  
So at any rate, His plus ability is nice, at worst, it disarms your opponent by killing his lands. At best, he just ate your opponent's with tw... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
